childArrangements.title: Making child arrangements
childArrangements.content:
You can choose how to make arrangements for looking after your children if you separate from your partner.

This is called making child arrangements (sometimes known as 'child custody' or 'child contact').

You can agree on child maintenance at the same time or separately.
childArrangements.contentInset: What you can do is different in Scotland and Northern Ireland.

unsureToMakeChildArrangements.title: If you are unsure how to make child arrangements
unsureToMakeChildArrangements.content:
You can get help making child arrangements if you need:

  • guidance on how to make arrangements for your situation
  • help and support services like legal aid or impartial advice

partnerAgreement.title: If you and your ex-partner agree
partnerAgreement.content:
You and your ex-partner may be able to avoid going to court if you agree on:

If you both agree, you can make a Parenting Plan. This is a record of what you've agreed.

getHelpWithoutGoingToCourt.title: Get help agreeing without going to court
getHelpWithoutGoingToCourt.content:
You can find out about:

  • how to use mediation to agree on child arrangements
  • other ways to agree without going to court

cannotAgreeOnEverything.title: If you cannot agree on everything
cannotAgreeOnEverything.content:
You can apply for a court order if you cannot agree after using a mediator or getting help.

If you decide to go to court, you’ll usually need to show you’ve tried mediation before you apply. You can get a voucher worth up to £500 to pay for family mediation, regardless of what you earn.

content.makingChildArrangements: Making child arrangements if you divorce or separate

content.howToStart: If you are unsure how you can start making child arrangements with your ex-partner, you can get help.

ifYouNeedHelp.title: If you need help deciding how to make child arrangements
ifYouNeedHelp.content: Use the 'Get help finding a child arrangement option' service to find out about your options for making child arrangements if you are a parent separating from your child's other parent.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.content:
You will be asked questions about your circumstances, including your current relationship with your ex-partner. You will not be asked for any personal details.

It takes about 10 minutes to use this service.

exitTheService.title: If you need to exit the service quickly
exitTheService.content: Each page of this service has an 'Exit this page' button to help keep you safe and protect your privacy if you need it.

getHelpChildArrangementOption.title: Get help finding a child arrangement option
getHelpChildArrangementOption.content: Your answers will not be saved or shared with anyone.
